'Stubbing My TOE on Purpose' is an exploration of a theory of everything that includes finding one's life purpose. In this book I've attempted to share a story with an expanded view of reality. It would be super cool if you'd share it. :)

SMToP is a combination of experience, research and synthesis of life's conundrums and potential answers. I've been told it is engaging and yet not overladen with details, which is the nemesis of a storyteller... too many details.

The capacity it has for introducing new thought as well as corroborating the lesser talked about experiences of others is one of my goals. I feel it is a seminal view of consciousness, cosmology and the congruence of science and spirituality.
The most important thing in music is what is not in the notes.

In learning how to play improvisational pieces, listening for the conversation taking place musically is the most important factor... the space between the notes provides the foundation for the best discussions.
I believe that to be true for conversations that matter in life, pausing and listening deeply before the desire to respond overtakes our consciousness.

Be The Dream, LLC offers practical services with a transformational twist, creating collaborative scripts toward higher productivity across the gamut of deliverables... possibilities and responsibilities. A Possibilities Coagulator, I facilitate life-changing activities, craft curriculum, build websites, manage digital marketing campaigns, assist self-publishers, manage small to large events, produce presentations and more for my clients. Philosophy: Changing how we think is tantamount to changing results. 'Possibility Coagulation' means that in the process of creating action plans we crystallize the fluid feelings and thoughts into working plans with SMART goals.Bridging state-of-the-art business management and coaching practices encourage and inspire clients with reason for change and growth in career or professional opportunities. A primary goal is facilitating deliberate creating, making the work fun and insightful while providing value-added features that come naturally with the process.Goals are dreams with deadlines. Dreams present possibilities to attract and solidify resources for you. Deadlines and commitments realized are what drive success, including career changes. Relationships are built to sail the ocean of emotion, yet navigation with last century's mindset often yields disastrous results. We align your vision, mission, passion and purpose for maximum results.Companies using the principles of 'co-presencing' recognize the need for inspiration in their workforce and/or staff. A clear advantage: "Do not hire Zen if you will settle for traditional guidance with no surprises. Don't hire Zen if you merely aim to fulfill some education requirement. You see, Zen is no ordinary consultant or facilitator. Do you have any idea how rare it is to find this kind of genius -- a distinguished guru who is a Gandhi-esque idealist and who also happens to have his feet firmly planted on the ground?" - Jack Dermody, City of Phoenix, Four Colors, retired

Brand Manager, Co-host, Digital Marketing, Social Media and Web Wizard2 Small Biz Guys is a business-talk focused radio show about small business concerns and opportunities with a twist of humor and personality. We launched in October, 2015, proved our concept and moved to a digital network in 2016. Check out http://2SmallBizGuys.com for more information and to schedule time.2 Small Biz Guys showcases local business owners from an array of solopreneurs, micro- and small businesses, local business notables and community leaders. We're narrowcasting to consumers and small business listeners with thousands of listens each show.We‚Äôll cover topics that include being an entrepreneur, micro-business, self-employment, business coaching, peer groups, strategic coaching, solopreneurs, how to grow your business and how to find business mentors. We don‚Äôt want you to go it alone. In today‚Äôs marketplace small business owners need help that many find hard to afford. Now you‚Äôll be able to get sound advice and insights without added expense.Each week we‚Äôll explore the dynamics of particular challenges and opportunities in a live show with our guest(s). Ray Silverstein and Zen Benefiel have over 60 years of combined experience across a variety of business environments. Ray built two companies to over 1,000 employees and sold them, creating President‚Äôs Resource Organization in 1993, forming and facilitating peer advisory groups for over 20 years. Zen has an MA in Organizational Management and an MBA in Project Management, with over 20 years of putting people, places and things together to achieve goals and objectives.

We have many digital offerings including Wordpress help and social media instruction. We also build websites and help create digital marketing campaigns on both free and paid service platforms. So far we've gotten every  SEO client FIRST PAGE ranking for their keywords - organically. No monthly fees for upkeep, either. We believe in personal service done the right way. We don't have to make money from you to help you, either, and offer a variety of digital reports and white papers.Planck's Constant - Relationship marketing with social media hinges on the ability to Know, Like, Follow, Share and Engage in Commerce. It is NOT about how many shiny objects you can put in front of someone. You might be aware of the science behind the service, energy x time  or momentum x distance. Einstein called it 'spooky action at a distance.' It's quantum physics applied to the web today.What does that mean for you?Our expertise, instruction and management deliver results over time - growing your reach and profits. Our Chief Possibilities Coagulator (CPC) has a proven track record across several industries on and off the Web, including radio and TV. We work hard and often over deliver on our promises, giving you a constant level of service that rocks.

Our Mission: Engage best practices in communication, construction, leadership and project management for partnering stakeholders.‚òÖ Concise ‚òÖ Effective ‚òÖ Insightful ‚òÖ Productive ‚òÖA partnering facilitator has transferable skills; project management with a flair for identifying & removing bottlenecks. The skill set empowers any goal-driven environment where disruption of non-productive habits and patterns is required.Team Partnering facilitation services engage and inspire best practices, commanding professionalism and delivers world-class products as a result. Developing effective communication and problem-solving methods are equally important in facilitating people, places and things to work together better; achieve goals and objectives beyond expectations. Strategic planning conversations create opportunities for excellence in performance. The little details make the difference in team performance. Conversations that matter take a project from just meeting contractual specifications to being a showcase product with long-lasting and powerful relationships.Cohesive teams garner premium results; injury-free product quality, time savings and value-added benefits for both owner and contractor. Cohesive teams reduce conflicts; fewer complaints, less disruption, angry staff, workers or costly litigation.  We spend time on details that determine optimal performance.Our clients/owners/teams include Department of Defense, Homeland Security, Customs and Border Patrol, Federal Highway Administration, Departments of Transportation, National Park Services, Port Authorities, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and more. Just a few of those projects are featured here.

Phoenix Chapter - Web Director to Conference Chair & President Elect

Support Chapter President, coordinate workshops and annual conference. Limited time for Pres-Elect duties as Conference Chair. Developed additional revenue sources with software training workshops. Created and managed annual conference 'The Shift - Challenge to Change: removing liabilities, limitations and excuses in the workplace.'"I was fortunate to work with Zen on the committee that planned and produced the ASTD Valley of the Sun 2010 Conference. Zen was enthusiastic about the conference - his commitment to creating content that would transform people was apparent from day 1. He had a vision, and shared it with the committee members to create excitement and forge a cohesive team. He worked hard to make the event better than in years past, and was tireless in his effort to find exceptional speakers, vendors, and content. He was passionate about providing the attendees (our members) with valuable information that would change them, and make them better employees, better managers, and better people. Working with and for Zen was an exceptional experience, as he proved to be an inspiring leader."Brian HolmstenSr. Consultant, Web-Based Training at CVS Health"Zen Benefiel has been a tremendous asset during his term as Website & Technology Director for the ASTD Valley of the Sun chapter. He has proved himself as an integral part of driving innovation and improving value to our membership. One of the qualities I admire most in Zen is that he goes the extra mile to assist and solve problems with his teammates. Put a challenge in front of him and he‚Äôll approach it with unrelenting determination and enthusiasm to find effective solutions. He takes great pride in getting the job done and making meaningful contributions. Due to Zen‚Äôs strong work ethic, he works well independently and is an effective advocate for positive change."Quincy ConleyAssistant Professor at Boise State University

May 26, 2016, Gina W. and Zen were students together

I was pleased to attend the SCORE sponsored "Build your business through LinkedIN" class that Zen facilitated.  To say that the class was extremely helpful would be a gross understatement!  Every issue and topic (some of these discussions went beyond LinkedIN) addressed during our 4-hour session were modern-day applicable without being so very techy which made it quite possible for those non-techs of us to understand.  Additionally, the classroom  and real life practice of the nuances of LinkedIn were very helpful as Zen encouraged classmates to assist each other as well.  Zen's refreshing and repeated attitude about on-line transparency was quite impressive - and he also offered personal insight re building a business.  I would take his class again !
